recipe_name: Creamy shiitake broth with griddled sesame beef
author: Lesley Waters
method: For the creamy shiitake broth, heat the oil in a frying pan and gently fry the onion and garlic for 2-3 minutes. Add the sliced chilli and mushrooms and continue frying for a further 4-5 minutes. Add the wine and cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. For the griddled sesame beef, rub the sesame oil into the beef and season well with freshly ground black pepper. Heat a griddle pan until hot, place the beef onto the griddle and sear on both sides, until cooked to your liking. Squeeze over the lime juice towards the end of cooking. To serve, ladle the broth into a shallow soup bowl and arrange the griddled beef on top.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  ½ onion, sliced,  2 garlic cloves, finely chopped,  ½ Scotch Bonnet chilli, finely sliced,  115g/4oz shiitake mushrooms, thickly sliced,  100ml/3½fl oz white wine,  100ml/3½fl oz double cream,  150g/5½oz fillet steak, sliced into three pieces,  2 tbsp sesame oil,  freshly ground black pepper,  ½ lime, juice only
